title: Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies Recipe
description: These oatmeal chocolate chip cookies are quick and easy to make and have the best texture - deliciously crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe:¬†Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Desserts Cookies Oatmeal Cookie Recipes Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies 4.6 (5,748) 4,613 Reviews 810 Photos I made these oatmeal chocolate chip cookies by modifying Beatrice's Excellent Oatmeal Cookies recipe. My boyfriend went crazy over them! I've never seen him enjoy cookies to that extent! He said I blew his mother's recipe away. Submitted by PANTHERA Updated on November 27, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 810 810 810 810 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 12 mins Total Time: 32 mins Servings: 42 Yield: 42 cookies Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Whoever said oatmeal cookies are boring has clearly never tried this recipe. Seriously, what's up with people hating on oatmeal cookies? Once anyone tries these chocolate- and nut-packed oatmeal cookies, they won't have another bad word to say. These oatmeal chocolate chip cookies have over 3,000 5-star reviews ‚Äî and we're pretty sure you're about to add another one. How to Make Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies These oatmeal chocolate chip cookies are super easy to mix up in a stand mixer or with your hand mixer. Simply cream together your butter (make sure it's soft for easy beating) and sugars. Then add the rest of the wet ingredients, then the rest of the dry ingredients. Mix in the quick oats, walnuts, and chocolate chips by hand so they don't get crushed. Luckily for you, these are drop cookies, so you don't even have to worry about working with the dough. Simply drop spoonfuls of dough onto ungreased baking sheets and bake them. What Are the Best Oats To Use For Cookies? We know, the oat selection in the grocery store can be quite overwhelming. There's just so many options to choose from. For oatmeal chocolate chip cookies, you should use either quick-cooking oats (like in this recipe) or old-fashioned oats. Old-fashioned oats will give you chewier cookies than quick-cooking oats, if that's what you prefer. How to Store Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies Store baked cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to two weeks. Though they probably won't last that long because you'll want to eat them all straight out of the oven! How to Freeze Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies You can freeze oatmeal chocolate chip cookies both baked and unbaked. To freeze baked cookies, store them in layers with a piece of parchment paper in between each layer in airtight containers or zip-top bags (make sure to squeeze out the excess air). Freeze for up to three months. To freeze cookie dough, place the dough balls on a baking sheet and place them in the freezer until solid. After the dough is hardened, transfer it to a zip-top bag (with the excess air squeezed out) and freeze for up to three months. When you're ready to bake, thaw the cookie dough in the fridge overnight and bake at 325 degrees F. You may need to add a few extra minutes to the baking time ‚Äî especially if the dough is still hard. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "These cookies are so good! Crispy on the outside and chewy in the middle. I had a lot of white chocolate chips so I mixed in white chocolate chips, then divided the dough and added butterscotch chips to half and chocolate chips to the other half," says HISTORYGIRL04. "After trying many different oatmeal cookies looking for the perfect chewy cookie I finally found this one! I do add some cinnamon and nutmeg because I like some spice in my oatmeal cookies. Perfect," raves Shannon. "These are delicious. Having made oatmeal cookies before, I found chilling them for 20 min before baking prevented the flat cookie. I did not put in any nuts, so my kids could take them to school. Otherwise I followed the recipe and we love them," according to Mamabear2017. Editorial contributions by Bailey Fink Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 42 servings 1 cup butter, softened 1 cup packed light brown sugar ¬Ω cup white sugar 2 large eggs 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 1 ¬º cups all-purpose flour ¬Ω teaspoon baking soda 1 teaspoon salt 3 cups quick-cooking oats 1 cup chopped walnuts 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips Directions Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Dotdash-Meredith Food Studios Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl. Set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat butter, brown sugar, and white sugar together in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time, until well combined; stir in vanilla extract. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir flour mixture into egg mixture until just blended. Mix in quick oats, walnuts, and chocolate chips. Drop batter by heaping spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS¬† I Made It Print 8,229 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies 01 of 810 Photo by¬† DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS¬† 02 of 810 Photo by¬† usmcofficer 04/09/2025 A very tasty cookie with a unique but appealing flavor profile. Both my wife and I, as well as my Marines, enjoyed them. I added a drizzle of melted Lindt almond chocolate, which gave an extra layer of sweetness without overpowering the cookie‚Äôs original flavors. The recipe strikes a good balance‚Äînot overly sweet, even with the chocolate drizzle‚Äîwhich I consider a plus. Overall, this is a solid recipe and definitely worth trying. 03 of 810 Photo by¬† LauraC 03/17/2025 A keeper! I used a smaller scooper for sizing consistency and used mini dark chocolate chips and left out the nuts. I baked them at 325 for 13 minutes. Perfection! 04 of 810 Photo by¬† StrongMash3421 02/14/2025 A keeper! I made these yesterday for my husband. He loves them. Some reviews said they had issues with them coming out flat. So I simply added a half teaspoon of baking POWDER.Also I didn't have quick oats and I used regular. No flat cookies here. I made a huge one for my daughter's 30 birthday since she despises cake. ü§£ 05 of 810 Photo by¬† CoolGouda7458 01/11/2025 OK with tweaks Good recipe but a little bit sweet with the chocolate chip, dark chocolate might be better. I made half the batch without chocolate chips and it was really good. I froze the batter overnight and baked for 23 minutes as I made it bigger and wanted a golden colour. Crispy edges and still chewy in the middle. 06 of 810 Photo by¬† Tj 12/23/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite This recipe was quite a hit! I was in the middle of baking cookies for an ALF. I had already baked Oatmeal, peanut butter, chocolate chip cookies. But this recipe just looked like a good one that I had to try. But, I wanted to change it up a bit so I substituted Craisens for the chocolate chips since I already the others with choc chips I also added a tsp of cinnamon and used pecans for the nuts. All else was kept per recipe.I noticed that some reviewers complained about the cookies taking too long to bake, tasting too sweet, and spreading and flattening during baking. I started baking Sourdough bread about 3 yrs ago and it was then that I purchased an oven thermometer, an instant read thermometer, and a scale. Those three have changed my life in the kitchen.I have a gas oven which shouldn‚Äôt matter (they have improved them over the decades) but things usually bake faster even though the thermometer says the temp is correct.1) For this recipe I had to let them bake 13 min removed them from the oven and let cool on the pan for 5 min before moving the to the wire rack to cool.2) Some commented the cookies spread out thin and stuck to the pan. I used parchment paper and had no issues and by the amount of melted butter on the parchment I can‚Äôt imagine them sticking to anything.3) I keep my butter cool before mixing with the sugars. If it gets too warm and melts it can change the texture and consistency.4) I used my digital scale to measure all dry ingredients. Volume doesn‚Äôt = weight. I‚Äôm wondering if that is why so many had runny, flattened cookies.5) I added all the flour and mixed with a wooden spoon (I don‚Äôt have a dough paddle or stand mixer and the dough was quite stiff) just until the flour was combined. You don‚Äôt want to over mix the dough. Then I stirred in oats, cranberries and nuts. I used a small scoop and it made pretty sturdy and even dough balls. 4 Dz. Some asked about the oats, I used Publix brand quick oats.This is a straight forward easy to follow recipe and you can change up your ‚Äúadd ins‚Äù. Different chips, fruits, nuts etc. the base ingredients I found to be perfect! 07 of 810 Photo by¬† Allrecipes Member 12/20/2024 Crowd-pleaser Family favorite A keeper! Quite easy to make and we will make them again. 08 of 810 Photo by¬† MintBoard7112 11/26/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Great flavors Crowd-pleaser Worth the effort Family favorite Super easy recipe to follow! I did exactly as instructed except I swapped out chocolate chips for butterscotch chips! OMG!!!!!! 09 of 810 Photo by¬† CandyInBC 10/25/2024 Easy to follow 10 of 810 Photo by¬† WORDFUN 10/11/2024 The cookies are very tasty and delicious. The only problem is that my cookies spread when I baked them. What's the secret to getting the cookies to look like your photo? I was very careful when I waited on the margarine to soften and also mixing the ingredients. name: PANTHERA
